sub_topic: Predicting the geometry and polarity of inorganic molecules
message_1: What is the molecular geometry and polarity of carbon dioxide (CO2)?
message_2:
The molecular geometry of carbon dioxide (CO2) is linear. In this molecule, the central carbon atom is double-bonded to two oxygen atoms. The bond angle between the oxygen atoms is 180 degrees.

Regarding polarity, CO2 is a nonpolar molecule. Although the carbon-oxygen bonds are polar due to the difference in electronegativity between carbon and oxygen, the linear geometry causes the dipole moments of the two C=O bonds to cancel each other out, resulting in an overall nonpolar molecule.
